page.title: 19DALRY CIVIC WEEK
page.content: The week began with the parade of bands, floats and the Civic Queen's horse and carriage. The crowning of the Queen took place in the town's main square. The Queen presented prizes to the best decorated float and the fancy dress winners at the Public Park where the fete was held. The Civic Week was planned to provide entertainment for all age groups. Children's parties, teenage discos, old folks' concert and general activities for all took place including the Blair Gymkhana, and displays of art, crafts and sports. Many functions attracted people from outside the town, particularly the road race and car treasure hunt. Sport was prominent in the week's activities and the large numbers of entrants, some taking part for the first time, showed their popularity.
